document_title: Corneal ulcers: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
If keratitis is not treated early and properly, complications can occur:
Corneal ulcers can heal after treatment, but they can leave opaque scars that reduce vision.; Other complications may include deep infection, corneal perforation, and displacement of the iris
In cases where the cornea is seriously damaged, a corneal transplant procedure may be used. However, it is necessary to find a corneal donor and the cost of a corneal transplant is quite high.
